intro: Cacalia baronii, commonly known as the Baron's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces delicate, lilac-pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Cacalia baronii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
